meanings.definition: To suffer for a sin or crime.
meanings.sent1: She had to abye for stealing the cookies.
meanings.sent2: He abyes the consequences of his actions.
meanings.sent3: The cat had to abye for knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The storm made the trees abye under its powerful winds.
meanings.sent5: The student abyes the rules of the classroom.

meanings.sent1: They will abye the long journey ahead.
meanings.sent2: She abyes the challenges with determination.
meanings.sent3: The car abyes the bumpy road without any complaints.
meanings.sent4: The old house abyes the test of time.
meanings.sent5: He abyes the pain of his injury without showing weakness.
